page.title: 16Good Old Days
page.content: While most people think of the village as expanding Mr. and Mrs. Coles think Culmstock has shrunk!They remember a time when there were five sweet shops,two bakers,a shoe mender, a blacksmith,a doctor and a nurse in the village.There were also some strong rules about keeping the village tidy.For if Mr Collier,the Lord of the Manor, found anything had been thrown in the river there would be trouble. Boys haven't changed much however and Mr. Coles remembers lots of mischief he got up to as a youngster.He also had to help at home and on Sundays he was expected to go to church and Sunday school.There were times when he dodged out of going and if his father found out he would get strapped.One thing that has improved are the roads as these were rough stone and riding a bicycle would lead to many punctures.
